review: I'm actually in love with this thing. I just bought a 125" projector screen and an Epson projector. The Fire Stick works with the projector seamlessly, and it's better than going to the movies. It's fast, so easy to use, and I love that it's not a giant console to carry around. The only issue with it is that I'm mad at myself for not getting one sooner!
author: Marjorie Gelso

review: Works great! I read a lot of people griping unnecessarily about the stick freezing or not working. Yeah, that happened to me too, on the third day. Know what I had to do? I had to walk all the way over to the TV and unplug the Stick then count to twenty and plug it back in. Sort of like a re-boot, you know? And then it happened. It worked again.People, just cuz you don't realize that a simple unplug and re-plug will fix the problem nine out of ten times, and you're too lazy to think or (god forbid) to actually call and ask customer support, don't blame the Stick. Your inability to use that gray sludge between your ears is YOUR problem, not Fire TV Stick's.The Stick works wonderfully, just as described. I couldn't be happier. Now if I can just get up the courage to cancel that damned cable connection!
author: Linda R

review: Fast, easy set up right out of the box. We were watching our Netflix and Amazon Prime videos in less than 20 min. We already had home Wi-Fi access, Netflix and Amazon Prime accounts, so all we had to do was login.  (Previously we accessed Netflix through our BluRay player, but it was slow and took several steps to connect.) The Firestick  remote is so easy to use. Our family is VERY pleased.  I highly recommend this device!
